paper_abstract: We propose a new random graph model - edge popularity - for the web graph and other complex networks, in which edges are deleted over time and an edge is chosen to be deleted with probability inversely proportional to the in-degree of the destination. We show that, with probability tending to one as time tends to infinity, the model generates graphs whose degree distribution follows a power law. Depending on the parameters of the model, the exponent of the power law can be any number in (2, infinity). (C) 2011 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: An edge deletion model for complex networks
